extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite      One of PHGY210 or PHGY214 or KNPE225 or KINE225
Exclusion    No more than 3.0 units from PHAR230; PHAR270.

basic.description:
This course introduces the basic principles an clinical applications of pharmacology. Topics covered include the general principles of drug therapy, the use of therapeutics in the nervous, cardiovascular, respiratory, endocrine and gastrointestinal systems and drugs used in infection, inflammation and cancer.
NOTE    Only offered online. Consult Continuing and Distance Studies.
NOTE    Not available to BNSc students.
NOTE    May not be taken for credit towards the Plan requirements of the LISC Specialization or Major Plans.
basic.subject: PHAR
basic.title: Fundamentals of Pharmacology and Therapeutics
